lenstronomy.Cosmo.Sampling package¶

Submodules¶

lenstronomy.Cosmo.Sampling.cosmo_likelihood module¶

class lenstronomy.Cosmo.Sampling.cosmo_likelihood.CosmoLikelihood(kwargs_lens_list, cosmology, kwargs_lower, kwargs_upper, kwargs_fixed, ppn_sampling=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

this class contains the likelihood function of the Strong lensing analysis

likelihood(args)[source]¶
Parameters:args – list of sampled parameters
Returns:log likelihood of the combined lenses

lenstronomy.Cosmo.Sampling.lens_likelihood module¶

class lenstronomy.Cosmo.Sampling.lens_likelihood.LensLikelihood(z_lens, z_source, D_d_sample, D_delta_t_sample, kde_type='scipy_gaussian', bandwidth=1)[source]¶

Bases: object

class for evaluating single lens likelihood

lens_log_likelihood(cosmo, gamma_ppn=1, kappa_ext=0)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • cosmo – astropy.cosmology instance
  • gamma_ppn – post-newtonian gravity parameter (=1 is GR)
  • kappa_ext – external convergence to be added on top of the D_dt posterior
Returns:

log likelihood of the data given the model
class lenstronomy.Cosmo.Sampling.lens_likelihood.LensSampleLikelihood(kwargs_lens_list)[source]¶

Bases: object

class to evaluate the likelihood of a cosmology given a sample of angular diameter posteriors Currently this class does not include possible covariances between the lens samples

log_likelihood(cosmo, gamma_ppn=1, kappa_ext=0)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • cosmo – astropy.cosmology instance
  • gamma_ppn – post-newtonian gravity parameter (=1 is GR)
  • kappa_ext – external convergence to be added on top of the D_dt posterior
Returns:

log likelihood of the combined lenses
